alert.note: Alert for Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 4:42PM CST until January 31 at 1:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Porter, Humble, Sheldon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Fork San Jacinto near Humble. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 49.3 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gauge. North side turnaround at US 59 begins to flood. Low points on Thelma Road, Aqua Vista Drive, and Riverview Drive begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM CST Sunday the stage was 48.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening to 49.7 feet late this evening. It will then fall late this evening. It will rise to 49.7 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 49.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 49.7 feet on 11/13/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (5 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed West Fork San Jacinto Humble 49.3 48.3 Sun 3 pm CST 49.1 48.1 47.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 445 AM CST.
